div.h3: As a result of the COVID-19 Virus in Oregon, all Sisters School District schools will be closed.

div.class: et_pb_module et_pb_fullwidth_slider_0 et_hover_enabled et_pb_slider et_slider_auto et_slider_speed_7500
et_pb_slide et_pb_slide_0 et_pb_bg_layout_dark et_pb_media_alignment_center et_pb_slider_with_text_overlay et-pb-active-slide

div.div: Nestled at the base of the three Sisters Mountains in scenic Sisters, Oregon, the Sisters School District welcomes students and families. It’s a great day to be an Outlaw.

div.h3: Outlaw Winter sports are in full swing. Join us for a basketball game, wrestling meet, ski race and more at home or away.

div.div: A sense of community echoes through the halls at each of the three schools within the Sisters School District. Staff, students, families, and community members work together to create a unique and positive learning environment.

Community support allows for unique programming opportunities throughout the Sisters School District. Programs like Ecos at Sisters Middle School and I.E.E. at Sisters High School get students outside and experiencing hands-on learning in fields like environmental science and physical education.

Families find success through a variety of working relationships with school staff and administrators to help each student find educational success. Special Programs coupled with a variety of advanced placement and honors courses ensures there is a place for all students in the Sisters School District.

div.h2: A Great Place to Live and Learn
div.div: Community partners help bring to life experiences that allow students to visit the Beijing, China to practice Mandarin Chinese, travel to “The Hutch” in Seattle, WA to test DNA, meet the First Lady of the United States, and more. Sisters Students are encouraged to pursue excellence through life experiences.

More than just a school system . . . Sisters Schools are a community.
We can see you here. Can you?

div.p: Sisters School District is nestled at the base of the Three Sisters mountain peaks. With stunning views and ample outdoor opportunities – classroom work is never dull.
Pulling from a community of just over 10,000 people, all three schools boast small class sizes, dedicated teachers and administrators and a supportive community.

Students can often be found studying biology in nearby Whychus Creek and Camp Polk Meadow Preserve, launching their own weather balloons, obtaining a pilot’s license at Sisters Eagle Airport, and taking part in reenactments of medical traumas in health classes with the local paramedics.

Chinese is taught at all three schools and students have opportunities to travel to China on an semi-annual basis. Both the I.E.E. and Ecos classes get students out and into the wilderness for hands on learning in social studies, environmental science, physical education and language arts. Students have the opportunity to build their own guitars, write and record music and sing along with nationally known recording artists through the Americana Program.
Does this sound like a great place? We think so…and we think you’d fit right in.

p.a: Click here to schedule a tour today.

div.p: If you are looking to enroll a student at any of our schools, click on the Learn More button below. On the Tyler SIS login page, click on PARENTS. Then click on the Register New Family link.

p.br: Sisters School District is committed to equal opportunity and non-discrimination in all of its educational and employment activities. The District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, religion, disability or age in its programs and activities and equal access to the designated youth organizations in the Boy Scouts of America Equal Access Act.

div.p:
The following individuals have been designated to handle inquiries regarding non-discrimination:
District 504 Contact: Martha Hinman | Email | 541-549-8521 Ext. 1160
District Title VI, Title IX, Age Discrimination & American Disabilities Act Contact: Jayel Hayden| Email | 541-693-5685

a.strong: View our Discrimination Complaint & Grievance Procedure Information
